title.value: Болезнь крупного рогатого скота, вызываемая мошками, и лечебно-профилактические мероприятия
A cattle disease, caused by midges, and treatment and prophylactic actions
A cattle disease, caused by midges, and treatment and prophylactic actions

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Skulovets, M.V., Pinsk State Agrarian Technological College (Belarus)

abstract.value: The research which objects the large horned livestock of various age groups served are ill by simulidotoxicosis, and midges of sorts Schaenbaueria, Boophthora, Simulium and others, showed that tio-sulphate of sodium in the dose of 0.02 g/kg of mass can be applied as anti-toxic means. It is injected into vein as a 5% solution. One can apply complex treatment by using ascorbic acid (3 mg/kg of mass twice a day) in combination with intra-vein injection of 40% solution of glucose (350-400 ml) and 10% solution of chloride of calcium (100-150 ml). We conducted successful tests of repellents, prepared from local herbs: Ledum palustre and Tanacetum vulgare. Artificial piretroids (stomazan, permetrin and baitikol) proved to be good insecticides. A complex of measures is a good means of treating and preventing the illness. Among its: land reclamation, creation of as far as possible adjustable water level in flowing reservoirs, change of a water level during larvae mass birth by means of hydraulic engineering sluices in places midges insect-production, mechanical clearing of a channel in system of by-pass channels and other irrigational constructions with a view of destruction of a substratum of water phases of midges, etc.
